column1: Inside every cell of our bodies is a long
column2: thin molecule called DNA. DNA is your own personal instruction manual and it tells your body everything it needs to know! DNA determines your eye color
column5: and even whether your muscles are better at sprinting or running a marathon. Just like a real instruction manual
column6: the instructions in DNA are written in a series of letters. In DNA
column10: and C. These letters are combined to spell out the instruction for proteins. Proteins are the building blocks of cells. Your brain
column12: and all other organs are made of lots of different proteins. The DNA letters needed to make one protein are referred to as a "gene." Can you guess how many genes a human being has?Over 20
